h1: Calories in a Pint of Blueberries
assumptions: Fresh, whole blueberries; approximately 300 g per pint (about 2 cups).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by berry size, ripeness, variety, and storage; values are averages. Check labels for packaged products.

quick_answer.text: A pint of fresh blueberries provides about 171 kcal, mainly from natural sugars and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged blueberries.

tweaks.label: Stewed with a dash of cinnamon (no added sugar)

faqs.q: How many calories in a pint of blueberries?
faqs.a: Approximately 171 kcal for a standard pint (300 g) of fresh blueberries.
Yes, at 57 kcal per 100 g, they're a low-calorie fruit packed with antioxidants.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in a pint of blueberries?
faqs.a: About 30 g of natural sugars, plus 7.2 g fiber to balance it.

faqs.q: Do frozen blueberries have the same calories as fresh?
faqs.a: Yes, unsweetened frozen blueberries have nearly identical nutrition to fresh.

faqs.q: What's the carb count for a pint of blueberries?
faqs.a: Around 43.5 g total carbs, mostly from natural fruit sugars.
